headline: RTX (RTX) Rises Higher Than Market: Key Facts
summary: RTX (RTX) concluded the recent trading session at $144.66, signifying a +1.39% move from its prior day's close.

headline: RTX Board of Directors Declares Quarterly Cash Dividend
summary: RTX (NYSE: RTX) announced today that its Board of Directors declared a dividend of 68 cents per outstanding share of RTX common stock. The dividend will be payable on September 4, 2025 to shareowners of record at the close of business on August 15, 2025.

headline: GE Aerospace: Too Much Hype, Upside Is Slim
summary: GE Aerospace may have 'limited upside' despite post-COVID growth, key engine projects, and challenges like China's COMAC C919 threat. Read more on GE stock.

headline: Trump Trade: Fannie, Freddie ordered to explore crypto as federal mortgage asset
summary: Catch up on the top industries and stocks that were impacted, or were predicted to be impacted, by the comments, actions and policies of President Trump with this daily recap compiled by The Fly: CRYPTO AS FEDERAL MORTGAGE ASSET: FHFA Director William Pulte has ordered Fannie Mae (FNMA) and Freddie Mac (FMCC) to explore crypto as an asset for single-family mortgage applications without converting it to U.S. dollars, CNBC’s MacKenzie Sigalos reports. headline: RTX Clinches a $250M Deal From MELCO to Produce ESSM Block 2
summary: RTX strikes a $250M ESSM Block II missile deal with MELCO, boosting Japan's self-reliant defense manufacturing push and expanding global defense reach.

headline: US Allies Wary of Buying American as They Plan Defense Buildup
summary: (Bloomberg) -- For European countries that just approved the biggest increase in military spending in decades, “Buy American” is looking a lot less appealing than it once was. They may have no choice.As the allies rush to rebuild their fighting forces, leaders are confronting the reality that they’ll have to rely on the US for many of the new weapons they’re planning to buy, a sales pitch driven home by President Donald Trump on his visit to Europe this week.They fret that they may be put at gre
